Dialogs.Dialog: 小早川
Have you gotten used to working as a library committee member？
Well, I think I'm still trying to get things to work out.
Yeah. You seem pretty serious about it, which surprises me.
Saying that it surprises you sounds a little rude.
Well, I've wanted to ask you this for a while. Why did you join the library committee？
Umm... And how about you, ▲小早川＊▲？ Because you like books, huh？
Not really. It's just... In the past, I didn't like to go home. That's why.
I see. But you're still doing committee work, right？
That's... because... currently, I... ...You know.
I said "you know" so you should know it... You wanna be kicked？
小早川
Hey, I also asked others why they've become library committees.
...You're still dwelling on it, huh？
Sort of. But I found someone with a very strong motivation.
A strong motivation？
He joined the library committee because he planned to read all the books in the library.
All the books！？ That's amazing...
Really amazing. He also read Japanese dictionaries and English-Japanese dictionaries. Even Rinko is amazed by that.
Eh...？ Don't ever think about finding some indecent vocabs from the dictionary yourself！
Who'd do that...？
Sorry... Well, it's what us guys like to play！
You mean "perverted" guys, don't you？
I'm sorry...
小早川
We have a survey box in the library, right？
...Ah, we had one. So, what about it？
There's this upperclassman who's in charge of writing the library newsletter.
She wanted to write something based on the survey, but it seems like no one submitted anything.
Well, I've never seen anyone putting any comments in it.
That's why she asked Rinko and the other first year students to submit some comments.
Which means those would be fake comments, right？ Will she be able to write an article from that？
Anyway, I've submitted some suggestions.
What did you write？
I asked that the library should have "The Complete Guide to Cheating" book available.
(What kind of book is that...？)
By the way, did fake comments plan for the survey box go well？
小早川
The upperclassman who was in charge of writing the newsletter got scolded by the teacher.
Was the fake comments plan exposed？
No, no. It was because of Rinko's suggestion.
There's no way a school's library would have "The Complete Guide to Cheating" book available...
I submitted it as a joke. Who would have known she'd actually use it...
That was really bad...
Anyway, next is your turn to write the comments.
Have you thought about it？
Well... How about "Please make more private reading rooms"？ We can use them when we want to nap, too.
In that case, just go home and sleep.
Okay...
小早川
By the way, the library committee will be holding a reading marathon.
Reading marathon？
They'll find who can read the most books within a limited time.
That's such a weird contest.
They compete by the number... Don't you think the books' contents are more important？
Instead of a marathon, it'd be fun to have reading long jump, reading pole vault jump, or reading hammer throwing.
How could people do that！？
Don't think that it's none of your business. All the committee members have to participate in this.
Really？
It's good for you to start reading, isn't it？
I might not look like it, but I actually read a lot of books, such as...
Comic books don't count, you know？
Yeah...
小早川
The reading marathon has started. Have you started reading something？
Yeah！ I've already read about 20 pages...
So, you haven't really read anything, huh？ Rinko is stuck at the third book now.
I see... You really read something, huh？
I used to have lots of time to read, but I don't have that much time anymore.
Why？
I have to spend time with you, right？
I see... Right！ We can read books during our dates. We can also exchange each other's favorite books to read.
I'll pass. It'd be a waste to read books when I can be together with you.
Don't smile like that！
(I'm not smiling！)
小早川
About the library's survey box.
Yeah？
There are some fools that requested the library to buy comic books.
Comic books？ I think that's a good idea.
No. We shouldn't be too lenient to allow such things.
Comic books aren't bad at all. There are many famous people who succeeded in their careers with influence of comic books.
Like, Jankees' Ichitaro. He read "The Left-Handed League" and now he had become a pro baseball player.
Rinko also reads a comic series called "NENE！"
But it's bad to have a lot of people come to the library to read them. A library is supposed to be a quiet place...
At any rate, Rinko will not compromise with this idea. It'll be total objection.
(Should I go along with her or not...？)
In the end, it seems like the library agreed to buy comic books anyway.
小早川
Yeah. Maybe many people requested for them.
It's already decided, so you can't do anything with it.
Maybe.
Anyway, I made a purchase list and submitted it to the teacher today.
Huh？ What did the teacher say？
The teacher praised me that the list was very appropriate for high school students.
Comic books that are appropriate to high school students？
"An introduction to the lay judge system through comic book" and "The story of Tokugawa Ieyasu in 26 Complete Volumes."
This way, I can keep peace in the library.
(I can't say that she lost in this case...)
小早川
Did you choose a book to write a review？
Is something the matter？
It was announced during the committee meeting, right？ That we have to submit our review for the contest.
Ah, is that so...？ This is troublesome. I'll have to look for a book.
How about you let Rinko choose one for you？
Is that okay？
It's what a girlfriend can do.
You save me.
It's gonna be a thick book~ So be prepared for it！
(I think I'd rather choose it myself...)
小早川
No one from our school won the book review contest, huh？
Well, it's a national contest, so that's difficult.
You also tried your best. This is regrettable.
But it took you so long to finish reading a book, huh？
That's because ▲小早川＊▲ chose a very thick book for me...
But... But, it was as fun as what Rinko told you, right？
Yeah. It was a genre I've never read before. It was fresh and interesting！
Well, I'll pick another book for you later. It'll be thick enough to be used as a weapon.
(That sounds dangerous somehow...)
Have you heard about a ghost in the library？
小早川
What？ No. I don't really care, but I'll listen if you wanna talk about it.
A girl with braids in a school uniform was crying in front of the innermost bookshelf in the library at night...
That's the one ▲小早川＊▲ was cleaning earlier, right？
A-Are you an idiot！？ There's no such thing as ghost！
So, you don't believe it？
Of course I don't. You're prohibited to talk about ghosts in front of me from now on.
But don't you feel like proving whether it's true？
I don't. Are you a kid or what！？
About the ghost in the library.
小早川
I told you that you can't talk about this story. Why did you bring it up？
Now, now. It was just a lie.
...Hmm？ That's reasonable. Because ghosts don't exist.
t was just some rumor made up by one of the library committee members.
I still doubt why people fell for rumors like that.
Now you can have a peace of mind when you go inside the library, right？
I don't care. The reason I didn't go there wasn't because I was scared.
I didn't go because I didn't have any business there.
Okay. ▲小早川＊▲ doesn't believe in these kinds of rumors at all.
Of course！
小早川
About the survey box.
Ah, are there any new requests？
Someone requested that our library should have CDs and DVDs to borrow too, because other libraries have them.
Huh？ Do libraries have such things too？
There are some recordings of traditional performances and some classic stuff... I don't really know much.
If that's the case, I might want to use this service too.
I'd suggested for God. Mt's or Killer Bambies' new releases too.
They are ▲小早川＊▲'s favorite artists, right...？
It'd be nice. It's called side benefit.
Ah！ If they have all DVDs of Super Transformer Volvavin, I can borrow them for my brother.
I don't think they'll ever have that...
小早川
About having CDs and DVDs in our library's collections...
Ah... How did it go then？
Still pending... I was told that they'd need some audio/video equipment for that and it'd cost money.
If they gave you that reason, it's probably a rejection.
I think so. To think about it, books are very economical media. I just wish for a bigger collection of books.
I think it's fine as it is now...
Right！ Let's submit comments to the survey box requesting for more books.
Do you think our library room has enough space for more books？
We can dispose worthless books. And if we still don't have enough room, we can confiscate the art preparation room, right？
(Confiscate...？ Since when does our library committee have that kind of authority？)
小早川
Hey, have you heard？ We'll have more books in the library！
Really？
An alumnus has donated a lot of books to our library！
It's worth the effort that ▲小早川＊▲ and I kept submitting requests, huh...？
So, this might be the answer to our demands, right？
I think so.
How many more books will we have？ We might have to clear some bookshelves...
Can we fit them in the shelves...？
That's our job！ I'm expecting my boyfriend to work hard on that！
(She looks so happy, so I think I can do it for her...)
小早川
We've cleaned the bookshelves in the library.
I didn't expect we'd have that many books coming...
Well, there were two truckloads of books.
Why did that alumnus donate the books to us...？
I heard he's a writer, so he bought a lot of books for his writing materials.
So those are books that he doesn't use anymore. Anyway, there are a lot.
Truth is stranger than fiction...
(I wonder whether writing materials for a writer would be fun for high school students to read.)
小早川
Urgh... What should I do...？
What's wrong？
It's Rinko's turn to write the library newsletter.
Is that so？ But you can just write it the usual way.
Well... The usual part has already been decided. But, for book recommendation...
Are you not good at writing that part？
I don't want people to think that I recommend a weird or uninteresting book...
Have you decided on the book yet？
Well, it's Rinko's favorite book.
If it's your favorite book, you can just relax and write it. I'll be looking forward to read it.
You don't have to read it！
(▲小早川＊▲'s favorite book, huh...？)
The recent library newsletter is very nice.
小早川
Did you read it？ I told you to not read it though.
Sorry, sorry. But I've already borrowed the book you recommended.
Ah... You borrowed it.
But it's unexpected that ▲小早川＊▲ likes to read that kind of book.
Why is that？ You mean it's unexpected for Rinko to read a romance novel？
I didn't mean that, but I think that kind of book is for very girlish girls...
Ah, really？ So you mean Rinko isn't girlish？
...Are you girlish？
You're driving me crazy！
Ouch！
小早川
About the survey box.
Again？ Now a lot of people are using it, huh？
Someone wrote "Please tell me the name and class of the girl who always sits by the window every weekend."
How can we know！？
Hey, I didn't ask you.
If she borrows some books, we can try to ask her name then.
She won't tell you. I think I'll help this guy find the name of the girl by the window.
Now you call her "the girl by the window," huh...？
By the way, how's it going with the girl by the window？
小早川
What？ You like to gossip about others？
Not really. I'm just interested in how things go.
I think everything goes well. They went to ride a swan boat at the lake together last Sunday.
That swan-shaped boat, you mean？ So we now have "the girl by the window" and "the boy in the swan boat"...
Anyway, he asked me if there are any nice date courses.
▲小早川＊▲ was asked？
He caught me in the library sometimes, so I just have to help him...
Well, to be able to live up to his expectation, we'll have to survey the date courses for him.
...Well, okay then. I'll tag along with you.
小早川
Yeah, earlier, we could only borrow five books at a time. Now we can borrow ten.
It must be because we have more collection of books, right？
Maybe. But it's gonna be hectic to control...
But as a book lover myself, I think this makes everyone happy.
Why？
Because we can borrow a lot of books at a time！
And what's so nice about that...？
Ah, yeah！ Now I can borrow the whole series of "The Lord of the Earrings"！
(How many books are there in the series...？)
小早川
I got lots of stuff today...
Yeah... You really borrowed a lot of books.
Well, since we're allowed to borrow more now, I just couldn't help it...
So you borrowed the whole series？ You could've borrowed one book at a time...
But it comes in a series！
If I read to some critical point and I don't know what's going on next, I won't be able to sleep！
But if you keep reading, you won't have time to sleep anyway.
Now, now. Just stop complaining！
Hey, I want to hurry home and start reading them. Can you walk faster？
(But I'm the one carrying your books...)
小早川
Did you know that our school records how many books the students borrow during their 3 years of high school？
No, I didn't know that. Do they keep such records？
Yeah, I just found out recently. Someone borrowed 1,680 books.
Hmm, there are 365 days per year... It's more than one book a day, eh？
It's amazing. Maybe Rinko should try to break this record.
No, no. It's impossible.
Or you can try to break the record yourself.
That's even more impossible.
Hmm, we should do something about it.
(I think you used to say that it's not about the quantity when it comes to books.)
小早川
I'm sleepy...
Hey, hey. Are you okay？ What's wrong with you？
I read books the whole night last night and when I realized it, it was already dawn.
Are the books that interesting？
No, I just picked some random books to read. I only need to break the record.
Ah, for the 3-year library record, huh...？ But don't overdo it.
Okay. It's not fun to read like this. Maybe I should stop.
You should. And if my girlfriend got too absorbed with books, I'd feel bored.
...Okay. I'll obey you this time. I don't want my boyfriend to feel lonely.
